post.summary: Get the current image for an environment
Get the zones a microservice is eligible for. This can be restricted to the zones that are serving traffic.
List images for the given application
Create a new vendasta service account
Generate and register a new client key with a service account
Delete a client key from a service account
View a list of all service accounts

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ChangeFailGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting change fail data for multiple apps.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: DeploymentFrequencyGetMultiResponse is the request body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple apps.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: LeadTimeGetMultiRequest represents the request body of getting lead time data for multiple apps.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
LeadTimeListRequest lets you list LeadTimes by app id or issue id (or both!)
If both app id and issue id are supplied the list will only contain one item as an app id and issue id combination
defines the primary key for a LeadTime.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: MTTRGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting mean time to restore (MTTR) stats for multiple apps.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: UserDeployFrequencyGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple users (developers).

post.summary: Creates a new application, this should match either an existing AppEngine project, vstatic app or a k8s Âµservice.
A delivery controls how a deployment of an application is hosted to the end user.

Creates a new deployment that is a child of an application. A deployment contains the artifacts of an
application (App Bundles, CSS, etc...)
Get security vulnerabilities associated with a microservice
Get the zones a microservice is eligible for. This can be restricted to the zones that are serving traffic.
Lists deliveries created by a user
List deployments for an application in created order descenging.
SendBuildNotification for the given build id

Gets the ServiceLevel for an associated github repository or service name. Github repositories may contain
more than one service so the response supports multiples as well.
Runs a query for services with the specified properties.

appId.title: unique identifier for the application (example: account-group)

appName.title: human readable name for the application (example: Account Group)

missioncontrolv1Environment.description: Environment represents a mission control environment that segments an application into test, demo, and production.

enabled.title:
If true, only the zones a microservice is serving traffic to will be returned, otherwise all zones a microservice
could be deployed to will be returned

author.title: The user who created the content

committer.title: The user who committed the content

message.title: the content of the git commit message

missioncontrolv1GitCommitDetails.title: The details of the git commit (if any)

missioncontrolv1GithubCommitUser.description: Details about the user who committed/authored a specific git commit.

cursor.title: cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: page_size specifies the number of items to return in the next page

missioncontrolv1PagedRequestOptions.description: Metadata for paging through a list/search endpoint.

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

missioncontrolv1PagedResponseMetadata.description: Metadata for paging through a list/search endpoint.

appId.title: unique identifier for the application (example: partner-center-client)

appName.title: human readable name for the application (example: Partner Center Client)

appType.title: Type of application eg. Vstatic, GoogleAppEngine, GoogleKubernetesEngine etc

entryUrlTemplate.title: DEPRECATED: Use the entry url template in the app config

prodConfig.title: Application configuration used for the production environment

demoConfig.title: Application configuration used for the demo environment

googleRepoName.title: The name of the source.cloud.google.com/repos for this project, ex. github-vendasta-mission-control

invalidConfigurationError.title: Provides details about an invalid missioncontrol.yaml file

alerts.title: Provides alerts about an application (for example, things to look out for after deploying, etc)

appRoot.description: If your application is not in the root of the repo, set this to the path. Ex: 'server', or 'sdks/go'.

defaultBranch.description: If your appplication does not use master as the default branch, set this, otherwise master is assumed.

missioncontrolv2Application.title:
Application represents a piece of software that can have only a single delivered artifact at any given time.
For example: the Partner Center has a single vStatic application called `partner-center-client`

missioncontrolv2Environment.description: Environment represents an environment that segments an application into demo and production deliveries.

enabled.title:
If true, only the zones a microservice is serving traffic to will be returned, otherwise all zones a microservice
could be deployed to will be returned

author.title: The user who created the content

committer.title: The user who committed the content

message.title: the content of the git commit message

missioncontrolv2GitCommitDetails.title: The details of the git commit (if any)

missioncontrolv2GithubCommitUser.description: Details about the user who committed/authored a specific git commit.

cursor.title: A cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: Specifies the number of items to return in the next page

missioncontrolv2PagedRequestOptions.title: Provides options for the paged request

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

missioncontrolv2PagedResponseMetadata.title: Contains metadata about the paged response

email.description: The email of the service account.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

privateKey.description: The matching private key for the public key generated by IAM. This key is not stored by IAM and can not be retrieved again.

keyId.description: The identifier of the matching public key.

email.description: The email of the service account.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

email.description: The email of the service account.

keyId.description: The identifier of the public key.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

serviceAccountId.description: The account id of the service account.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

email.description: The email of the service account.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

gitHash.title: if applicable, the git hash of this deployment

created.title: Output only - Time the deployment was created

containerBuilderId.title: Optional - Google Container Builder ID that built and published this deployment

gitCommitDetails.title: Output only - Details about the provided git_hash

branchName.title: if applicable, the git branch name of this deployment

applicationId.title: The unique identifier of the application

v1OrderByDirection.title: Indicates the sort order for SearchServiceAccounts

orderByDirection.title: Indicates to sort by ascending or descending

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

environment.title: The environment to do this operation on

nextCursor.description:
A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the
the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

v1ServiceAccount.title: Representation of a Vendasta Service account

enabled.title: Should this zone serve traffic for this application and environment

v2Alert.title: For providing alerts about an application (for example, things to look out for after deploying, etc)

appengineProjectId.title: The appengine project ID for this App (APP_TYPE_GAE)

entryUrlTemplate.description:
A entry url to the application which contains the string <deployment>.
This will be used to create a deployment view link in mission control,
and <deployment> will be replaced with the specific deployment id.

deliveryMethods.title: The methods by which this application can be delivered

v2Artifacts.title: Code artifacts used for an application deployment

v2BuildStatus.title: BuildStatus represents the status of a build

current.description: The change fail data for 'current' period of time (e.g. current last 90 days).

previous.description: The change fail data for 'previous' period of time (e.g. previous last 90 days).

v2ChangeFailData.description: ChangeFailData represents the change fail statistics for a period of time (e.g. last 90 days).

v2ChangeFailGetMultiRequest.description: ChangeFailGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting change fail data for multiple apps.

v2ChangeFailGetMultiResponse.description: ChangeFailGetMultiResponse is the response body of getting change fail data for multiple apps.

deploymentId.title: The unique identifier for the created deployment

environment.title: Environment that this delivery is for

appId.title: The ID of the application the delivery is for

deploymentId.title: The ID of the deployment being used for this delivery

deliveryId.title: The unique id for the delivery

environment.description: The environment this delivery is for.

created.title: The date the delivery was created

updated.title: The date the delivery was last updated

userEmail.title: The email of the user who created this delivery

zone.title:
The name of the zone to deliver to (Only specify if Zone delivery type)
DEPRECATED: Zone should now be provided with the specified Delivery Method

deliveryMethodId.title: The id of the delivery method this delivery should use

automated.title: Delivery was initiated automatically. This is normally true for deliveries triggered by pipeline

message.title: The message that the delivery creator leaves to provide context on the delivery. ie. rollback reason

isRollback.description: A bool to indicate whether this delivery is a rollback.

buildId.description: The build ID used to create the deployment. This can be provided to a create delivery request as an alternative to the deployment ID.

v2Delivery.title: The delivery is the action of a setting a deployment for an application

userEmail.title: The email of the user that is locking delivery for this type

message.title: Message as to why delivery needs to be locked

created.title: The date the lock was created

deliveryType.description: The type of deliverer to handle deliveries with this method.

args.title: Extra arguments passed to the deliverer when creating a new delivery with this method

description.title: descripton of this method of delivery (Optional)

deploymentId.title: (Ouput Only) The ID of the deployment

gitHash.title:
if applicable, the git hash of this deployment
if the deployment contains a "range" of commits this would be the ending hash

artifacts.description: The arficacts to be served for this application.

environment.description: Environment to scope this deployment to.

created.title: Output only - Time the deployment was created

updated.title: Output only - Time the deployment was last updated

buildId.title: Optional - Google Cloud Builder ID that built and published this deployment

gitCommitDetails.title: Output only - Details about the provided git_hash

author.title: Output only - The creator of the deployment

name.description: If deploying a custom artifact, a name is required.

branchName.title: If applicable, the git branch name of this deployment

statusDescription.title: An optional description of why the deployment is in the current status

gitHashBase.title:
Optional The git_hash of the base hash included in this deployment
if the deployment contains a "range" of commits this would be the starting hash

additionalGitCommitDetails.title: Output only - Additional Details about the provided commits

k8sConfig.title: Output only - Details about the kubernetes specific details of this deployment

v2Deployment.description: Deployment represents an immutable artifact that can be delivered to the end user.

rate.title: The average rate over time of the deployment frequency for this application

stats.description: stats is a list of snapshots of a stat over time.

v2DeploymentFrequencyData.description:
DeployFrequency provides a gauge for the current rate of the stat, i.e. 5/day, as well as a graphable stat over time,
a repeated set of dates and values, that can be plugged into a graph or sparkline.

v2DeploymentFrequencyGetMultiRequest.description: DeploymentFrequencyGetMultiResponse is the request body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple apps.

v2DeploymentFrequencyGetMultiResponse.description: DeploymentFrequencyGetMultiResponse is the response body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple apps.

buildId.title: Optional - Google Cloud Builder ID that built and published this deployment

automated.title: Event created from an automatic process. This is normally true for deliveries and rollbacks triggered by pipeline

probableAppType.description:
The most likely type of the app that was built. This is determined based on the first step of the build so it's
not a guarantee, but it is most likely to be accurate.

triggerName.title: Name of the trigger that caused the build. May be empty

buildLogUrl.title: Link to the build logs for the event

clusterContext.title: k8s context for this deployment - ie which cluster context should be used to deliver this commit

controller.description: How should this deployment's pods be managed? By default we use a Deployment.

v2K8SConfig.title: Details about the kubernetes specific details of a deployment

id.title: A unique identifier for this LeadTime. It is a string consisting of "<app_id>|<issue_id>"

appId.title: The app id this LeadTime is for, i.e. "mission-control"

deliveryIds.description:
A list of delivery ids that were involved in this lead time. One deployment id can be delivered multiple times,
so there may be many more delivery ids than deployment ids.

deploymentIds.description: A deployment id links with a commit to git, and can be delivered to many zones.

environment.title: Environment will almost always be ENVIRONMENT_PROD

issueId.description:
The issue id associated with this lead time. Can be looked up in our current issue tracker (hopefully) for
additional context.

duration.description: The amount of milliseconds of lead time there was for this issue.

created.description: When the LeadTime was first created.

updated.description: When the LeadTime was last updated.

v2LeadTime.description:
LeadTime represents the amount of time it took (duration, in ms) for the issue in question (issue_id) to go from
its first commit to its latest deployment to production. The list of deployment_ids could be used in conjunction with
the app_id to see which deployments they link to.

v2LeadTimeGetMultiRequest.description: LeadTimeGetMultiRequest represents the request body of getting lead time data for multiple apps.

v2LeadTimeGetMultiResponse.description: LeadTimeGetMultiResponse is the response body of getting lead time data for multiple apps.

v2LeadTimeListRequest.description:
LeadTimeListRequest lets you list LeadTimes by app id or issue id (or both!)
If both app id and issue id are supplied the list will only contain one item as an app id and issue id combination
defines the primary key for a LeadTime.

v2LeadTimeListResponse.title: LeadTimeListResponse lists lead times requested and options for how to get more (if there are indeed more)

current.description:
The lead time data for 'current' period of time (e.g. current last 90 days).
The unit is Milliseconds.

previous.description:
The lead time data for 'previous' period of time (e.g. previous last 90 days).
The unit is Milliseconds.

v2LeadTimeSummary.description: LeadTimeSummary represents the lead time summary for an app for a period of time.

appId.title: The unique identifier of the application

environment.title: The environment to scope the deployments to

appId.title: Filters response to only include events for this application (optional)

environment.title: Filters response to only include events for this environment (optional)

eventType.title: Filters response to only include events of this type (optional)

start.title: Filters response to only include events that occured after this time (optional)

userEmail.title: Filters response to  only include events created by this user (optional)

current.description: Mean time to restore stats for 'current' period of time (e.g. current last 90 days).

previous.description: Mean time to restore stats for 'previous' period of time (e.g. previous last 90 days).

v2MTTRData.description: MTTRData represents mean time to restore stats for a period of time (e.g. last 90 days).

v2MTTRGetMultiRequest.description: MTTRGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting mean time to restore (MTTR) stats for multiple apps.

v2MTTRGetMultiResponse.description: MTTRGetMultiResponse is the response body of getting mean time to restore stats for multiple apps.

message.title: Optional - A message to include in the resulting slack notification

repository.title: Optional - The repository to include in links within the project. It will default to the application id

gitHash.title: Optional - The git hash the build notification is for. Used in the absence of a deployment

githubRepoUrl.title: The github repo for this service

platform.title: The platform this service runs on

language.title: The language the service is written in

availability.title: The availability target (SLO) for this service

readiness.title: The readiness status of the service

hardDependencies.title: List of dependencies of the service (transitive dependency)

statsPerUnit.description: Number of stats that occurred during the unit period of time.

v2StatRate.description: Represents a rate of some particular stat. Final composed version would be 4.6666/day, 5/month, 3/quarter, etc.

v2TimeRange.description: TimeRange defines time ranges used in app metrics.

appId.title: The ID of the application the delivery is for

deliveryId.title: The unique id for the delivery

environment.title: Environment that this delivery is for

buildId.title:
(optional) BuildID - If provided it will update ALL deployments with this buildID
deployment_id and environment of one instance are still required

deploymentId.title: The unique identifier for the created deployment

rate.title: The average rate over time of the deployment frequency for this application

stats.description: stats is a list of snapshots of a stat over time.

v2UserDeployFrequencyData.description:
UserDeployFrequencyData provides a gauge for the current rate of the stat for a user (developer),
i.e. 5/day, as well as a graphable stat over time,
a repeated set of dates and values, that can be plugged into a graph or sparkline.

v2UserDeployFrequencyGetMultiRequest.description: UserDeployFrequencyGetMultiRequest is the request body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple users (developers).

v2UserDeployFrequencyGetMultiResponse.description: UserDeployFrequencyGetMultiResponse is the response body of getting deployment frequency data for multiple users.

alternateEmail.title: An alternate email that we should use to try and tie settings to a user
An alternate email that we should use to try and tie settings to a user
